title: NullReferenceException in CheckIfRunningTests()
body:
While executing below code in debugging mode, I get `NullReferenceException`. Things work when running normally in non-debugging mode. The `CsProjName` is a `NetCoreApp`.

```csharp
var msBuildProject = new Build.Evaluation.Project(CsProjName);
```
### Expected  behavior
works.

### Actual behavior
Get `NullReferenceException` with below call stack.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12488060/41322826-051b829a-6e60-11e8-9f73-88acc8add1c8.png)


### Environment data
`msbuild /version` output:

```cmd
Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 15.7.177.53362 for .NET Framework
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

15.7.177.53362
```

OS info:

If applicable, version of the tool that invokes MSBuild (Visual Studio, dotnet CLI, etc):
VS2017, dotnet version `2.1.200` running on Windows 10.
